证明Martingale的三种方法

三种基本方法

  1. Et(Xt+1)=Xt

  1. Et(dXt)=0​

  2. Et(Xt+1Xt)=1

用Ito's lemma的特殊技巧

  1. 绝招：对Xt使用Ito's lemma, ⇒dXt=a(Xt,t)dt+σ(Xt,t)dWt

只要a(Xt,t)=0，则Et(dXt)=0+Et[σ(Xt,t)dWt]=0，即用方法二证明为martingale。

或使用∫tTdXs=0+∫tTσ(Xt,t)dWt，而所有伊藤积分都是martingale，所以Et[XT−Xt]=Et[∫tTdXs]=0​，即用方法一证明为martingale

或者直观地，martingale的定义是不能有deterministic term，不能有trend，而drift就是deterministic term

  1. 对于包含积分项的Xt，考虑将其写成伊藤积分的形式（《题型2: 用Ito's lemma求积分》），利用“伊藤积分都是鞅”的性质

Stochastic Differential Equation

(1)Sk−Sk−1=Ek−1[Sk−Sk−1]+ΔWk
(2)Ek−1[ΔWk]=Ek−1[Sk−Sk−1−Ek−1[Sk−Sk−1]]=0

ΔWk是增量innovation，增量的期望为0，说明Wk=∑i=1kΔWi是martingale

innovation的方差

(3)Vk=E0[ΔWk2]=σk2h>0

因为ΔWk随机，所以方差≠0；若方差=0，就不随机。

σk是与h无关的常量，可以对ΔWk做标准化使得Vk=h，此时的SDE为

(4)Sk−Sk−1=Ek−1[Sk−Sk−1]+σkΔWk

不严谨地，Ek−1[Sk−Sk−1]=f(Ik−1,h)，泰勒展开

(5)f(Ik−1,h)=f(Ik−1,0)+f′(Ik−1,0)⋅h+residual

h=0说明时间不变，价格也不会变，所以f(Ik−1,0)=0（f是表示价格变化期望的函数）

(6)∴Ek−1[Sk−Sk−1]≈f′(Ik−1,0)⋅h→h→0f′(It,t)dt

整理后

(7)dSt=a(It,t)dt⏟drift+σtdWt⏟diffusion

Wiener Process

Wt is a square integrable martingale with W0=0, and E[(ΔWt)2]=Δt

Properties:

  • 相关为零E[WtWs]=0,t≠s​

  • Wt∼N(0,t)

  • ΔWt=Wt+1−Wt∼N(0,1)

Brownian motion

Bt is a brownian motion if B0=0, ΔBt∼N(0,Δt)​​

题型

  1. 求形式为E[eWt]的期望

    1. 求条件期望

      (8)Et[eσWt+1]

    2. 求无条件期望

      (9)E[e(μ−12σ2)t+σWt]

    需要用到Moment Generating Function

    (10)fX(x)=12πσ2e−(x−μ)22σ2
    (11)MX(t)=eμt+12σ2t2

  1. 求形式为[Xt]2的SDE：诀窍是将Xt看作整体，即便Xt=eWt−12t很复杂

Ito Integral

什么是Ito integral？

(12)Wt=∑u=0nΔWu→Wt=∫0tdWu

或者

(13)∫0Tσ(u,Su)dWu

结论1: (dWt)2=dt

用Mean square limit，不加证明得到结论

(14)E[∑i=0n−1Δxti+12]=T

假设xt是Wiener process，

(15)limn→∞[∑i=0n−1Δxti+12]=∫0T(dxt)2=T

因此

(16)∫0T(dxt)2=∫0Tdt⇒(dWt)2=dt

结论2: Ito integral is a martingale

单个增量为martingale，则总量也是martingale

(17)Et[∫tt+ΔσudWu]=0
(18)⇒Es[∫0tσudWu]=∫0sσudWufor s<t

需要指出的一点是，伊藤积分

(19)∫tt+Δσ(u,Su)dWu

中diffusion项σ(u,Su)通过Su与Wu相关联，如果diffusion与Wu无关的话（如σ(u,Su)=σ(u)），退化成黎曼积分。

可以用黎曼积分计算伊藤积分来验证两种积分的差别，会发现黎曼积分下增量的条件期望≠0，与不可窥探的性质矛盾。

结论3: Ito's lemma

Ito's lemma是随机环境下的链式法则。

对于f(t,St)，

(20)t→f(t↓,St)
(21)t→ΔWt→ΔSt→f(t,St↓)

先考虑离散情况，全微分方程

(22)Δf(k)=fsΔSk+ft⋅h+12fss⋅(ΔSk)2+12ftt⋅h2+fst⋅(hΔSk)+R

Substitute SDE ΔSk=akh+σkΔWk

(23)Δf(k)=fs⋅(akh+σkΔWk)+ft⋅h+12fss⋅(akh+σkΔWk)2+12ftt⋅h2+fst⋅h⋅(akh+σkΔWk)+R

省略?h→0,(h→0)的项，记得(ΔWk)2=Δt=h⇒ΔWk=h

只留下

(24)Δf(k)=fs⋅(akh+σkΔWk)+ft⋅h+12fss⋅(akh+σkΔWk)2

整理得

(25)Δf(k)=fs⋅ΔSk+ft⋅h+12fss⋅(ΔSk)2

最后一项(ΔSk)2可以再化简

(26)(dSk)2=(atdt+σtdWt)2=at2(dt)2+2atσtdt⋅dWt+σt2(dWt)2=0+0+σt2(dWt)2=σt2dt
(27)dft=∂f∂StdSt+∂f∂tdt+12∂2f∂St2σt2dt

概念: Quadratic variation 二次变差

上面的(ΔSk)2就是二次变差，严格地可以表示为

(28)⟨X⟩t=lim∥Δt∥→0∑i=0n−1(Xti+1−Xti)2

where ∥Δt∥ is the mesh of the partition 0=t0<t1<⋯<tn=t.

Insight: 对于deterministic的积分二次变差为0，因为函数连续。而Wiener process (Brownian motion) 的二次变差为t

结论4: Itô's Isometry

只在Wiener process/Brownian motion下有效，有用到增量的独立性和均值为0的性质

(29)f(s)=∑i=1nfi1(ti−1,ti](s)

where 0=t0<t1<⋯<tn=t and fi are Fti−1​-measurable random variables, the stochastic integral is defined as:

(30)∫0tf(s)dWs=∑i=1nfi(Wti−Wti−1)

Consider

(31)(∫0tf(s)dWs)2=(∑i=1nfi(Wti−Wti−1))2
(32)(∑i=1nfi(Wti−Wti−1))2=∑i=1nfi2(Wti−Wti−1)2+2∑1≤i<j≤nfifj⋅(Wti−Wti−1)(Wtj−Wti−1)

Due to independence of increment of Wiener process / Brownian motion

(33)E[(Wti−Wti−1)(Wtj−Wti−1)]=0for i≠j
(34)E[(Wti−Wti−1)2]=ti−ti−1
(35)E[(∑i=1nfi(Wti−Wti−1))2]=∑i=1nfi2E[(Wti−Wti−1)2]=∑i=1nfi2(ti−ti−1)

Rewrite:

(36)E[(∫0tf(s)dWs)2]=∑i=1nfi2(ti−ti−1)=E[∫0tf(s)2ds]

题型1: 已知F(St,t), 求全微分dFt

关键：写出St的SDE形式

(37)dSt=atdt+σtdWt

对F用伊藤引理，别忘了σt

题型2: 用Ito's lemma求积分

  • 构造F(St,t)

  • 对F用Ito's lemma

  • 对等式两边求积分

e.g. Calculate ∫0tWsdWs

Define F(Wt,t)=12Wt2

e.g. Calculate ∫0tsdWs

Define F(Wt,t)=tWt​

Special thing about this problem:

(38)∫0tsdWs=tWt−∫0tWsds

题型3: 用Itô's Isometry求方差

(39)dXt=−μXtdt+σdWt

Calculate Var(Xt)

By defining f(Xt)=eμtXt and apply Ito's lemma, we can solve the SDE:

(40)Xt=e−μt(X0+σ∫0teμsdWs)
(41)E[Xt]=e−μtX0
(42)E[Xt2]=e−2μtX0+σe−2μt⋅E[∫0teμsdWs]2

其中

(43)E[∫0teμsdWs]2=E[∫0t(eμs)2ds]=12μeμs|0t

Solution of SDE

(44)dSt=aStdt+σStdWt

逻辑：先用ODE的思路解，对解求全微分，对比与原先SDE的差别（S0exp⁡{adt+σWt}），调整。

(45)St=S0exp⁡{(a−12σ2)t+σWt}

贴现的例子

(46)St=e−r(T−t)Et[ST]

由于

(47)ST=S0exp⁡{(r−12σ2)T+σWT}=S0exp⁡{(r−12σ2)T}⋅exp⁡{σWT}
(48)E0[ST]=S0e(r−12σ2)t⋅E0[eσWt]

首先求解E0[eσWt]

Zt=eσWt, apply Ito's lemma.

(49)dZt=σeσWtdWt+12σ2eσWtdt

Integral on both sides. Use W0=0⇒E[Z0]=1 and "Ito integral is martingale".

(50)E0[Zt]=1+∫0t12σ2E0[Zs]ds

现在E0[Zt]是deterministic的，直接用ODE求解

(51)E0[Zt]=e12σ2t

with E0[Z0]=1

再考虑conditional expectation Et[eσWT]

(52)Et[eσWT]=Et[eσWt⋅eσ(WT−Wt)]=eσWt⋅Et[eσ(WT−Wt)]

其中Et[eσ(WT−Wt)]等同于unconditional expectation，所以

(53)Et[eσWT]=eσWt⋅e12σ2(T−t)=e12σ2(T−t)+σWt

Girsanov Theorem

(54)ξt=exp⁡{∫0tXudWu−12∫0tXu2du}

We need to apply Itô's Lemma for functions of both t and Wt. Itô's Lemma for a function f(t,Wt) is given by

(55)df(t,Wt)=(∂f∂t+12∂2f∂Wt2)dt+∂f∂WtdWt.

In this case, let

(56)Yt=∫0tXudWu−12∫0tXu2du

Then, ξt=eYt.We apply Itô's Lemma to f(Yt)=eYt:

(57)dξt=eYtdYt+12eYtd⟨Y⟩t

where d⟨Y⟩t is the quadratic variation of Yt.

First, compute dYt: dYt=XtdWt−12Xt2dt.

Next, compute the quadratic variation d⟨Y⟩t: d⟨Y⟩t=Xt2dt.

Now, substitute dYt and d⟨Y⟩t back into Itô's Lemma:

(58)dξt=eYt(XtdWt−12Xt2dt)+12eYtXt2dt.

Simplify the expression:

(59)dξt=ξt(XtdWt−12Xt2dt)+12ξtXt2dt.

The dt terms cancel out:

(60)dξt=ξtXtdWt.

Markov Property

Geometric Brownian mation satisfies Markov property.

To prove the Markov property, we need to show that:

(61)P(St+s≤y|{Su,0≤u≤t})=P(St+s≤y|St)

Conditional Distribution of Wt+s−Wt : Since Wt is a standard Brownian motion, the increment Wt+s−Wt is normally distributed with mean 0 and variance s : Wt+s−Wt∼N(0,s)

From the solution to the SDE, we have:

(62)St+s=Stexp⁡((μ−σ22)s+σ(Wt+s−Wt))

The term σ(Wt+s−Wt) is normally distributed as N(0,σ2s) . Therefore, St+s conditioned on St​ can be written as:

(63)St+s|St=Stexp⁡((μ−σ22)s+σZ)

where Z∼N(0,s) .

The conditional probability density function of St+s given St​ is log-normal:

(64)P(St+s≤y|St)=P(ln⁡St+s≤ln⁡y|St)

Given St​ , we have:

(65)ln⁡St+s=ln⁡St+(μ−σ22)s+σZ

Since Z∼N(0,s)​ , we can write:

(66)ln⁡St+s|St∼N(ln⁡St+(μ−σ22)s,σ2s)

The distribution of St+s given St depends only on St and not on the past history of the process.
